secondaryIdInfos.domain: Building Interdisciplinary Research Careers in Women's Health (BIRCWH) - K12

identificationModule.briefTitle: The Effects of Orchiectomy and Age on Vascular and Metabolic Health in Older Versus Younger Transgender Women
identificationModule.officialTitle: The Effects of Orchiectomy and Age on Vascular and Metabolic Health in Older Versus Younger Transgender Women

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This study plans to learn more about differences in heart disease risk after gender-affirming orchiectomy (i.e., testes removal) in older transgender (trans) women compared to younger trans women.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: The global aim of this study is to characterize cardiometabolic risk (measured by vascular, metabolic and biochemical factors-which have not been extensively studied prospectively) in trans women before and after orchiectomy. Trans women appear to be at greater risk for cardiovascular disease (CVD) and blood clots compared to non-trans adults. The effect of orchiectomy on CVD risk among trans women is unknown, but orchiectomy may change blood vessel function and metabolic health. The investigators will examine blood vessel function and metabolic profiles of trans women before and at several timepoints after orchiectomy to identify age-related differences in CVD risk factors. This knowledge may lead to new approaches to prevent CVD in trans women as well as all people regardless of gender identity.

armGroups.label: Older transgender women
armGroups.description: This cohort will consist of healthy transgender women aged 45 and above who have not undergone but desire orchiectomy, who have been on estrogen (history of oral, transdermal or injectable) and spironolactone for at least one year.

armGroups.label: Younger transgender women
armGroups.description: This cohort will consist of healthy transgender women aged 18-44 who have not undergone but desire orchiectomy, who have been on estrogen (history of oral, transdermal or injectable) and spironolactone for at least one year.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Evaluation of endothelial function (flow-mediated dilation (FMD) at Baseline
primaryOutcomes.description: Brachial artery flow-mediated dilation (FMD), as measured by ultrasound.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Evaluation of endothelial function (flow-mediated dilation (FMD) at 1 Month
primaryOutcomes.description: Brachial artery flow-mediated dilation (FMD), as measured by ultrasound.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Evaluation of endothelial function (flow-mediated dilation (FMD) at 6 Months
primaryOutcomes.description: Brachial artery flow-mediated dilation (FMD), as measured by ultrasound.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Evaluation of endothelial function (flow-mediated dilation (FMD) at 12 Months
primaryOutcomes.description: Brachial artery flow-mediated dilation (FMD), as measured by ultrasound.

secondaryOutcomes.description: The carotid artery compliance index indicates how elastic the artery is. The index describes the change in arterial blood volume in response to a change in arterial blood pressure. Lower numbers are associated with worse outcomes (less elastic arteries).

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Evaluation of carotid artery beta stiffness index
secondaryOutcomes.description: The carotid artery beta stiffness index indicates how stiff the artery is. Higher numbers are associated with worse outcomes (stiffer artery).

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Evaluation of oxidant burden: oxidized LDL
secondaryOutcomes.description: Oxidized low-density lipoprotein (LDL) measured in the blood and endothelial cells.
Nitrotyrosine measured in the blood and endothelial cells.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Evaluation of vascular endothelial cell inflammation: nuclear factor kappa-light-chain-enhancer of activated B cells (NFkB)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Protein NFkB (nuclear factor kappa-light-chain-enhancer of activated B cells) measured in blood and endothelial cells.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Evaluation of vascular endothelial cell inflammation: MCP-1
secondaryOutcomes.description: Monocyte Chemoattractant Protein-1 (MCP-1) measured in blood and endothelial cells.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Evaluation of vascular endothelial cell inflammation: IL-6
secondaryOutcomes.description: Interleukin 6 (IL-6) measured in blood and endothelial cells.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Evaluation of vascular endothelial cell inflammation: CRP
secondaryOutcomes.description: C-reactive protein (CRP) measured in blood and endothelial cells.
Blood pressure will be measured at baseline, 1 mo., 6 mo. 12 mo.
Total cholesterol will be determined at baseline, 1 mo., 6 mo., 12 mo.
Triglycerides will be determined at baseline, 1 mo., 6 mo., 12 mo.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Whole body composition: Percent Lean Mass
secondaryOutcomes.description: Percent lean mass will be determined using dual energy x-ray absorptiometry.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Whole body composition: Percent Fat Mass
secondaryOutcomes.description: Percent fat mass will be determined using dual energy x-ray absorptiometry.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Regional body composition: Percent Lean Mass
secondaryOutcomes.description: Regional percent lean mass will be determined using dual energy x-ray absorptiometry.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Regional body composition: Percent Fat Mass
secondaryOutcomes.description: Regional percent fat mass will be determined using dual energy x-ray absorptiometry.
Bone density of femur and spine will be determined using dual energy x-ray absorptiometry.
Body weight will be measured at baseline, 1 mo., 6 mo., 12 mo.
Physical activity will me monitored for 7 days with an ActivPAL monitor
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 7 days at baseline, 1 mo., 6 mo., 12 mo.

secondaryOutcomes.description: Energy intake will be estimated with a 3-day food diary
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 3 days at baseline, 1 mo., 6 mo., 12 mo.

secondaryOutcomes.description: Sex hormone concentrations of estradiol, testosterone, follicle stimulating hormone (FSH), luteinizing hormone (LH) and sex hormone-binding globulin (SHBG) will be measured

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Aged 18 years and older
* Identify as a transgender woman
* Have taken estradiol and spironolactone for at least one year
* Currently taking oral or transdermal or injectable estradiol
* Have not yet undergone but desire orchiectomy

Exclusion Criteria:

* Under 18 years of age
* Don't identify as a transgender woman
* Not currently taking estradiol or spironolactone
* Have been on estradiol and spironolactone for less than one year
* History of orchiectomy
* Not deemed a candidate for orchiectomy
* Current tobacco smoker
* Current illicit drug use
* History of prior or active estrogen-dependent neoplasms
* Acute liver or gallbladder disease
* Venous thromboembolism
* Hypertriglyceridemia \>500 mg/dL
* Fasted plasma glucose \>7.0 mmol/L or previously treated diabetes
* Resting blood pressure \>140/90 mmHg
eligibilityModule.genderDescription: Transgender women (people who were assigned male at birth but whose gender identity is female). They may or may not have legally changed their gender marker.
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Transgender women from the Denver metropolitan area and/or who utilize health care at University of Colorado Hospital.
